Container.Name: rw-photonix
Container.Overview: Photonix is a photo management application that streamlines the process of storing, presenting and re-discovering photos. Once set up it will ingest all the photos in your collection and start building up an image database of everything you could want to search and filter by. It makes your entire collection available to you, whichever device you’re using — as long as you can get to a web browser.

Config.Name: Environment
Config.Description: (prd or dev) In prd mode, running code and services are as optimised as possible. Running in dev mode enables features like Webpack/React hot module reloading (HMR), Django Runserver (code auto-reloading), Storybook server etc.

Config.Name: Demo Mode
Config.Description: Starts the environment with a demo user account, library and downloads some demo photos. This is how the demo at https://demo.photonix.org/ runs

Config.Name: Sample Data
Config.Description: Creates same account, library and photos as in DEMO mode but still allows you to make modifying changes as a user (most useful for developers).

Config.Name: Admin Username
Config.Description: Creates a username for the admin user on first run

Config.Name: Admin Password
Config.Description: Sets password for the admin user on first run. If this is set but ADMIN_USERNAME is not, the username will be admin

Config.Name: Postgres Password
Config.Description: Password for Postgres database.

Config.Name: Postgres Port
Config.Description: Port for Postgres database.

Config.Name: Redis Host
Config.Description: Redis hostname, used for resource locking.

Config.Name: Redis Port
Config.Description: Redis port number.

Config.Name: Redis Database
Config.Description: Redis database number.

Config.Name: Allowed Hosts
Config.Description: Restricts access for Django backend to be accessed from just a certain hostname.

Config.Name: Django Secret Key
Config.Description: Sets value for Django to use as a secret key (sessions, hashing, signing etc.). By default we automatically generate a cryptographically secure key on first run and store it in Redis for future.
